definitions:
(intransitive) to speak; to talk (to say words out loud)

Para de falar. ― Stop talking.
Fala! ― Talk!
Fale! ― Talk!

(by extension) to communicate by any means

Falamo-nos por correio. ― We communicate by mail.

(transitive) to say something

Para de falar bobagens. ― Stop talking nonsense.
Fala bobagens. ― Talk nonsense.

(transitive with com) to talk to

Estou falando com você ― I'm talking to you.

(transitive with para) to tell (to convey by speech)

Vou falar para você. ― I’m going to tell you.
(transitive with de or sobre) to talk about
(transitive with de) to speak ill of

(transitive) to speak (to be able to communicate in a language)

Em Portugal se fala português.

In Portugal they speak Portuguese.
description: falar (first-person singular present indicative falo, past participle falado)
etymology: From Old Portuguese falar, from Latin fābulārī, present infinitive of fābulor (“chat, converse”).
